snippet: Anthony Hennis, 22, who was pushing his son in a stroller in Brooklyn on Sunday when a bullet ended the boy’s life, may have been the intended target. But he’s not answering questions, the police said.
abstract: Anthony Hennis, who was pushing his son, Antiq, in a stroller in Brooklyn when a bullet ended the boy’s life, may have been the intended target, but police say he’s not answering questions; Hennis has history of drug arrests, including for selling heroin.

byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and JULIE TURKEWITZ

lead_paragraph: Anthony Hennis, 22, who was pushing his son in a stroller in Brooklyn on Sunday when a bullet ended the boy’s life, may have been the intended target. But he’s not answering questions, the police said.

headline.main: After 1-Year-Old Is Killed, Father Is Silent About Suspects
headline.print_headline: Man Who Saw 1-Year-Old Son Killed in Stroller Is Silent
